Under the programme, Airbus has been tasked with developing and deploying a next-generation […]
The post Ariane 6 Selected to Launch German Military Communications Satellites appeared first on European Spaceflight.
detailed_news: Arianespace has been awarded a contract to launch a pair of SATCOMBw-3 communications satellites for the German Armed Forces. The contract covers the development of the two geostationary satellites, the associated ground segment, the launch of the satellites (which is expected to occur before the end of the decade), and the operation of the constellation.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 28 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The Starlink 10-15 mission comes a day after SpaceX launched a trio of spacecraft to study the effects of the Sun. Liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is scheduled for 4:39 a.m. EDT (0839 UTC).
detailed_news: SpaceX launched its Falcon 9 rocket from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station. The Starlink 10-15 flight will add another 28 Starlink V2 Mini satellites to the growing megaconstellation of more than 8,400 currently on orbit. Forecasters predict mostly clear skies and light winds at the surface and aloft for Monday’s launch.

title: Artemis II Crew Ready to Fly Around the Moon on “Integrity”
summary: Today the four Artemis II crew members announced the name they have chosen for their Orion capsule — Integrity. During an hour-long news conference, they conveyed readiness for their mission […]
detailed_news: Artemis II crew members announced the name they have chosen for their Orion capsule — Integrity. The goal is to fly around the Moon, but the spacecraft and life support systems first must pass tests in Earth orbit before NASA decides to execute the Trans-Lunar Injection (TLI) burn. The crew said today enabling Artemis III is their measure of success. Space weather is caused by coronal mass ejections (CMEs) from the Sun. CMEs create breathtaking auroras on Earth, but also can disrupt electrical systems and orbiting satellites. Artemis II crew can shelter in Orion’s storage compartments if there is a CME during their 10-day flight.

title: The dynamic drone-rover duo with a special bond
summary: The martian landscape is not the easiest terrain to get around. Some areas are too rocky for a wheeled rover to cross, and elsewhere a lack of distinctive features in the landscape can cause problems for a camera-based navigation system. For a flying drone, such a navigation issue can mean the difference between a safe landing and a crash. Dielof van Loon, a student from Delft University of Technology, investigated what would happen if the two explorers – rover and drone – teamed up.

SpaceLaunch appears to have been founded in January 2025 by two former Firefly Aerospace employees with a combined 40 years of experience in the industry.

title: Blue Origin only bidder for new VIPER lander award
summary:
Blue Origin was the sole bidder for a NASA task order that revived a canceled lunar rover mission.
The post Blue Origin only bidder for new VIPER lander award appeared first on SpaceNews.
detailed_news: NASA announced Sept. 19 it had selected Blue Origin to deliver the Volatiles Investigating Polar Exploration Rover. The rover will fly on the second mission of Blue Origin’s Blue Moon Mark 1 lander. Many were surprised because NASA had previously awarded a CLPS task order to Astrobotic. NASA has not yet defined whether the scope of this new operations effort will be the same as the originally planned VIPER project. That project will be based at Ames Research Center, which managed the original VIPER effort. Jeff Foust writes about space policy, commercial space, and related topics for SpaceNews.

title: Curiosity Blog, Sols 4661-4667: Peaking Into the Hollows
summary: By Susanne P. Schwenzer, Professor of Planetary Mineralogy at The Open University, UK Earth planning date: Friday, Sept. 19, 2025 Curiosity is currently driving along the ridges of a very uneven terrain. One of the bigger ridges we nicknamed “Autobahn,” which is the German word for a highway. But the rover didn’t stay on that […]
detailed_news: Curiosity is currently driving along the ridges of a very uneven terrain. One of the bigger ridges we nicknamed “Autobahn,” which is the German word for a highway. DAN informs us about hydrogen in the subsurface underneath the rover. Mastcam and ChemCam are taking images of many different features in the landscape. Rocks outside the crater rim, 90 kilometers away (about 56 miles) were taken with the remote micro-imager of ChemCam and with added Mastcam context. They show what will have been the source region for some of the sediments we saw very early in the mission. You can spot some patterns, too. The ridge tops are more smooth, mostly at least.

title: Chinese spacecraft image Maxar remote sensing and U.S. early warning satellites
summary:
Chinese spacecraft have imaged orbiting U.S. commercial and military assets as the two countries seek to demonstrate and assess respective capabilities.
The post Chinese spacecraft image Maxar remote sensing and U.S. early warning satellites appeared first on SpaceNews.
detailed_news: Chinese spacecraft have imaged orbiting U.S. commercial and military assets. The images were taken by CGST’s Jilin-1 remote sensing constellation satellites. CGST originally planned a 138-satellite constellation, but announced in 2022 that it aims to more than double this to 300 satellites. Shiyan-12 (02) made a close approach Sept. 11 to an early warning satellite. Shiyan satellites are experimental spacecraft which analysts believe are used to trial new systems. The series appear to have been used for a range of purposes, including technology demonstrations. While many Shiyan satellites operate in low Earth or near-polar orbits, a number have recently headed to GEO, while the Shiyan-10 designation satellites entered Molniya orbits.
